_header: Now gracious God grounded of all goodness
_description: The Ludus Coventriae, or N-Town Plays — a Mystery Cycle of forty-two plays

BodMal4.First Lines:
The xxix pagente to Pylatus wyffIn slepe apereth ye devyl of
                    helle…
BodMal4.Last Lines:
…He hath forgyven his male intenteHer shy deed to
                    day
BodMal4.Note:
A post-medieval transcript of 4 plays from London,  British Library Cotton Vespasian D.VIII
                    (Crucifixion, Woman taken in adultery, Mary and Joseph, and
                    Creation)
BodMal4.Attributed Title:
De muliere in Adulterio deprensa (second play, p. 77); Ego sum
                        alpha et omega, principium et finis (fourth play, p. 109)

BLCottVesDVIII.First Lines: Now gracious god grounded of all goodnesseas þu greet glory never beginning had…
BLCottVesDVIII.Last Lines: …not after oure dede so us quythWe haue synnyd we be to blame
BLCottVesDVIII.Note: An 18th-century transcript by George Stevens is London,  British Library Addit. 27945.
BLCottVesDVIII.Attributed Title:
The plaie called Corpus Christi (f. 1, added to top margin); De muliere in Adulterio deprensa (second play, p. 77); Ego sum
                        alpha et omega, principium et finis (fourth play, p. 109)
